activities.loc: Monroe County Justice Center - Branch III

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Arthur Vinney

defendant.name: Vinney, Thomas Arthur
defendant.address: 16442 County Highway W, Camp Douglas, WI 54618

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas Arthur Vinney appeared by phone.  Attorney Croninger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Debbie (Defendant's wife appears with Defendant). Right to an attorney was given. Defendant states that he is employed and will proceed without an Attorney as he cannot afford one. Defendant waives rights for an attorney. Charges and max penalties were read. Court enters not guilty pleas . 
Pre-trial offer: 11/14/22 (By email)
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/Schedule scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Thomas Arthur Vinney appeared by phone.  Attorney Long appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Charges and max penalties were read. Court orders $500 signature bond with conditions to be signed by 8/12/22.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
